data.meta_description: Aksel Sandemose (19 March 1899 - 6 August 1965) was a novelist, born in Nykøbing, Mors Island, Denmark to a Danish father and a Norwegian mother.  In 1930 he settled in Norway. One year later he published his first book written in Norwegian. Although by then an established author, his breakthrough came in 1933 with the novel En flyktning krysser sitt spor (A Fugitive Crosses His Tracks), English translation 1936). As many of his other works, the novel was based upon his upbringing in Nykøbing at
